document.docOrigin: Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society 146 (4)
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the New World eximius lineage of Anelosimus (Araneae, Theridiidae) and a phylogenetic analysis using worldwide exemplars

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the New World eximius lineage of Anelosimus (Araneae, Theridiidae) and a phylogenetic analysis using worldwide exemplars
Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society

subSubSection.paragraph:
The results corroborate the monophyly of
Anelosimus s.s.
(excluding
Kochiura
and
Selkirkiella
, see Agnarsson, 2004 ), Figures 58 and 59 . Agnarsson (2004) found marginal support for
Anelosimus
, based on a single synapomorphy: ridges on the surface of the epigynal plate ( 4 -1, Figs 48A, B , 53B ). With more species in the analysis this synapomorphy supports the subsidiary Eb clade within
Anelosimus
(see Fig. 58 and below). Here
Anelosimus
synapomorphies are: an entire conductor ( 37 -1, Fig. 8C ), lack of pars stridens on prosoma

Rows represent characters and columns taxa. The first state is ‘0’, second ‘1’ etc. ‘?’ represent missing data, ‘–’ inapplicable states. Refer to ‘Character descriptions and comments’ for further information on characters. Taxon abbreviations: Ste,

Anelosimus spp.
numbered as in the text and figures.

( 90 -0, Figs 14G , 15A ), three palpal tibial trichobothria ( 118 -1, Fig. 15G ), robust femur I ( 119 -1, Fig. 55G ) and communal (subsocial) behaviour ( 145 -1). The clade excluding
Anelosimus sp. 1
(this undescribed species differs so much in genitalia from other species that it substantially changes the diagnosis of the
Anelosimus
and may, for the sake of clarity, later be placed in a new genus) is supported by: elongate (wide) epigynal plate ( 3 -1, Figs 19C, D , 44C, D, I, K ), incised cymbial mesal margin ( 15 -1, see e.g. Agnarsson, 2004 , fig. 22A), terminally ridged theridiid tegular apophysis ( 57 -1, Fig. 55D ), lobed embolus tail ( 68 -1, Fig. 28B ), abdomen pattern ( 98 -1, Figs 27H–M , 49E ), and absence of sticky silk in web ( 142 -1, but see Discussion on character 142).
